sections.heading: INC-20A Filing: Starting a Business (MCA)
content: Send in INC-20A to legally set up and run your business online. Stay out of trouble with the law and ROC.
Companies that are incorporated in India must file an INC-20A with the ROC to start doing business. A business can't legally start working without filing INC-20A.
Get help from experts to quickly and correctly file your INC-20A.

sections.heading: What does INC-20A mean?
content: This is an MCA form called INC-20A that is filed to confirm that:

points: The shareholders have paid the share capital they promised
The business is ready to start up
Section 10A of the Companies Act, 2013 says that it must be done

sections.heading: Who Needs to File an INC-20A?

points: Private Limited Companies
One Person Companies (OPC)
Public Limited Companies with share capital
Not for LLPs or businesses that don't have any shares

sections.heading: Due Date for INC-20A
content: Within 180 days of the date of incorporation
If you wait too long, you could face fines and the risk of your company being shut down.

points: ₹50,000 fine for the business
₹1,000 fine per day for directors (up to ₹1 lakh)
ROC may start strike-off proceedings
Filing INC-20A on time is very important for keeping your business going.

sections.heading: Things You Need to File INC-20A

points: Bank statement showing paid-up share capital
Certificate of Incorporation
Company PAN and other information
Proof of payment from a subscriber

sections.heading: What You Need to Know About Filing an INC-20A

points: Required to start a business
Required to fully open bank accounts
Stops ROC notices and fines
Makes sure the company is marked Active

sections.heading: Frequently Asked Questions about Filing INC-20A

list.title: Do all businesses have to file an INC-20A?
points: Yes, this applies to all companies in India that have share capital.

list.title: Can a business start without an INC-20A?
points: No, you can't start doing business legally until you file INC-20A.

list.title: What happens if you don't file INC-20A?
points: ROC can punish the company and take it off the list.

list.title: Does INC-20A apply to LLP?
points: No, INC-20A does not apply to LLPs.
